I had shrimp roll appetizer which were shrimp wrapped in rice paper, fried and served with a delicious dipping sauce. I've tried two entrees: the fried chicken over fried rice (delicious crispy chicken and fantastic fried rice) and pad khee mao (wonderful flat fried noodles with green beans and bell peppers). All items are beautifully presented with fresh flowers and artistically cut fruit and vegetables. The pad khee mao had an option of choosing a 1 to 10 level of spiciness. I had a 3 and it was still very spicy.  
The staff were friendly and helpful, frequently checking on us and refilling drinks. I definitely recommend!
author: Julie B.

description: I've had a lot of Thai food since I lived in NYC and I have to say that the food here was really good.  The ambiance is 3 stars, but the food and service was 5 stars, so I think the place deserves 5 stars.  I came here with my family and we had pineapple fried rice (really delicious), pumpkin curry (really really good), pad thai (good, but nothing stellar), pad see ew (good).  Great place to go for a low key dinner.  Excellent food
author: Michael S.

description:
I'm torn. I recently ordered delivery from Million Thai through Eat24 and had a mixed experience.

On the one hand, the pumpkin curry (got it with chicken) was really delicious. However, the pad see eew (got it with beef) was REALLY bitter - it didn't taste right.

Additionally, I had to send back my order and get a new order because there was a  hair in my curry and shards of shattered plastic in the pad see eew. There was still shards of plastic in the second pad see eew I got - they need to figure out their packaging. It would have been nice if they had offered some type of refund... It's quite disturbing to find foreign objects in your food.

I'm thinking the dine-in experience would be better, but I think I'll stick to other local Thai spots for delivery.
author: Rachel O.

description: Horible service with nasty attitude. Food was ok, but the thin short hair waitress "Ning" had everyone's food mixed up. I asked for extra ice since the water jug was room temperature and she gave me a dirty look. Then when asked for a copy of the receipt she practically tossed it at me and made a sweeping motion with her hands telling me to go away now. Poor poor poor service! I will never go to this place again!!
author: Carlos C.

description: Great food (what the rating is for). Uber Eats totally screwed up the meal by forgetting an item.  You should cancel your relationship with them as they are screwing up your reputation.
author: Scott V.

description:
There's a multitude of Thai restaurants in the Union Square area for reason and we ended up here just out of convenience. We tried Chabaa but that place was tiny and we had to wait for a table.

So at Million Thai, no wait needed. Interior was small but relatively nicely decorated (less of a hole-in-the-wall like Chabaa). Wait-staff took our orders promptly and we were soon munching down on stir fried beef and egg plant over rice along with a large bowl of tom yum.

Beef with egg plant - sweet tasting for American tastes but nothing spectacular - Average

Tom yum - mushrooms and chicken floating the soup. Not robust and tart as usual. Soup also tasted sweet and ingredients were a bit sparse. Below average.

Considering the sheer number of Thai restaurants in the area, Million Thai doesn't make the cut.
author: Norman S.

description: Food was delicious - we got a pad see ew and an orange curry, and both were so flavorful! Delivery was fast too.
author: Michelle A.

description:
Great taste papaya salad "Tum Tard" A Must Try!
This place has authentic Thai food.
1-10 level of spicy you can choose, 7 is pretty hot and good taste for me.
author: Mewadee R.

description: Used a Groupon to order takeout, Pad Kee Mao and Thai Chicken Satay, order was ready in the 15 minutes it was promised, food was tasty, chicken was not tender but was ok.
author: Daniel P.

description: Some of the best Thai food I've ever had! Everything was so fresh and tasty! We waited a bit long for our food which is the only reason I didn't give it 5 stars but it wasn't a big deal. We will be back for sure!!
author: Tristan C.

description: I ordered a chicken dish (garlic pepper I think) with brown rice. The rice tasted like it was 2 months old and was made of plastic. I asked for a fresh batch and they said they were out of brown rice - which probably means they initially dumped some leftovers on me. I got white rice instead. After tasting a couple of chicken strips I felt like my mouth was on fire. Incredibly spicy dish, not flagged in any way on the menu. I decided to pay and leave without finishing, will never go back.
author: Catalin D.

description: Came here the other night with a Groupon. The husband and I arrived 2 minutes before the kitchen was closing, however the staff was very friendly and let us stay to eat in. I ordered a tofu yellow curry, and the husband ordered the yellow pumpkin curry. Both of our dishes came out quick, hot, and to our liking. We will definitely come back.
author: Tracy C.

description: The food tastes pretty bad. Went there just because I saw 4 stars from Yelp. Really have no idea why they have 4 stars review! I would never go back! Don't trust the review here!
author: Grace C.

description:
Be careful with this restaurant they try to robe you. Pay attention carefully with your receipt.!!!!!!!!!!!!!
I went to this restaurant few times the food was pretty good
And little bit pricy. I don't mind as long is good.
In front of the restaurant there is the sign pat thai lobster $14
So I older fried rice lobster substitute pad thai with fried rice with thai ice tea.
The food was good but all the lobster is just bull shit they just give me the empty lobster shell and they charge me $26 after finish my meal in my receipt $26 for the lobster fried rice and $2.75 for thai ice tea.
And they charge me with gratuity $5.18
What in the world, I make a complein with the waiters you not suppose to charge with gratuity becouse gratuity is for party of 6 not for one person  and she said is because the tourist area. What the hell that is tenderloin what she mean tourist area. 
Never ever return to this scary restaurant.
author: Susan Y.

description: There are gazillion Thai restaurants in my neighborhood, but I discovered this cute place in the Union Square area through Groupon, and it has become my favorite takeout ever since. The Pad See-Eew(sp?) and Green Curry are some of the finest I've ever tried, among other dishes like the Papaya Salad and Satay, and the staff is always welcoming and friendly. I'd like to return for a dine-in experience to enjoy the tropical decor and a very casual ambiance in the near future, though street parking in this area is a challenge. Thanks to Groupon for introducing me to this hidden gem!
author: Yumi T.

description: Great food and great service!!!!!!! Attentive servers... Deliciously prepared and beautifully presented dishes!
author: Ella H.

description: We relied on Yelp to choose this restaurant.  The yellow curry with chicken was excellent as was the Thai fried rice with pork.  The service was efficient and the food came quickly.
author: Jerry W.

description:
Staff was friendly and fast. Food was tasty and a deal for its quality. I recommend the calamari salad and one of their curries.

The shrimp rolls were also very good.
author: Chele D.

description:
I've got somewhat mixed results ordering here. First time I got hot thai tea, pad see ew, and panang curry. At first I thought the pad see ew was kind of tasteless, but it turns out it was just because the sauce had kind of all fallen to the bottom, so the lower noodles were quite tasty. The curry was also delicious. The rice both times also tended to be kind of mushy, which was sad.

Unfortunately, the second time I ordered from them the results were no where near as good. I ordered green curry, pad thai, and hot tea again. The green curry was ok, but the panang was definitely better (I generally prefer panang anyway). The pad thai was kind of meh. Worst of all, the "hot" tea was, at best, luke warm. I mean, they put it in a plastic cup (previously it had been in one of those cups you often see for coffee to-go), so it clearly couldn't have been that hot to begin with. It also tasted like barely flavored water more than tea.

I'll probably give them another chance, so I guess I'll see what the final verdict is.
author: Emily F.

description: Great food and service. Had the Pad See Ew and it was delicious. This is my gauge dish when I first eat at a Thai restaurant. Nice people and pleasant decor. I will be back for sure!
author: R M.

description:
This is the first place I have dinner when I come to San Francisco. It's almost like coming home. It's an tiny unassuming place. But the staff are lovely. And then they give you a hot towel to wash your hands. The fresh prawn rolls are excellent and look like a simple sushi roll. 
Pad See Ew with duck is amazing.
author: Eric J.

description: Million Thai is a quaint friendly restaurant. You can relax with a beer or wine and not to mention delicious apps and meals. Even tho I saw amazing meat Idishes, being vegetarian i was impressed with vegan and vegetarian options. And the sweet pretty waitress let me know they were more than glad to substitute tofu for any dish. Also located in a terrific location.
author: Laura Y.

description: The delivery was over 40 minutes late. I called several times to ask what the status of the food was, and they just kept saying that it was "on its way with the delivery person" - clearly not true. To add insult to injury, one of the plastic food boxes was smashed when we received it, and the food was filled with small plastic shards. The food was marginal at best. Would not order again.
author: Helen L.

description: Awful.  I've been here twice and both times were bad experiences; I honestly don't know how the reviews are so positive.  Tourists perhaps?  Tonight I called in an order for Salmon curry and when i arrived my bill was almost $20.  WHAT???  I have ordered this dish at almost every Thai restaurant in the city and never paid over $16 for a tiny dish of curry (I didn't even get rice!!!)  On top of that I was very emphatic that it be cooked medium rare.  What did I get?  The driest most crusty piece of fish imaginable with two slices of squash and... oh wait I just found a single mushroom, eureka!  Never again.
author: Alicia B.

description:
Wow. Absolutely wow. This was a first. 

My order came 1 hour and 25 minutes after ordering. I was told it was gonna be 45 to 60min. But whatever mistakes happen. 

HOWEVER when the driver came he immediately said "hey so you didn't tip enough on the order." That was the first thing out of his mouth. When I complained for being unwilling to tip more he reacted horribly. Wow.
author: Sam P.

description: The service was alright, I think it could have been better. The noodle was a bit bland. Other than that everything taste great.
author: Bebe P.

description: Just ordered delivery from here at work. I got fried egg rolls and pad see ew.  I asked for medium spicy and it tasted like no spice, but luckily I had some SriRacha.  Otherwise the food was very tasty.
author: Angela R.

description: The servings were especially small and not worth the wait or the money spent. There was less that a cup of basil chicken and more sticky rice than necessary. The green curry chicken had good flavor with not much chicken at all.
author: D J.

description: The food was really good , but they are not sanitary at all. I saw the lady sneeze all over, didn't cover her mouth, then she came out of the bathroom with her disposable gloves still on gross. Now I have a horrible stomach ache.
author: Denise R.

description: Great food.  It's my favorite go to place when I'm staying in town. Fresh Rolls are very good and green curry is excellent!
author: Jim M.

description: Nearby my hotel, easy to find. Service was good and food was good. You can never go wrong with Tom Kha or curry. My daughter likes noodles so the noodle soup. There isn't much room but anything with a party of 5 or less is good.
author: Sally K.

description: 10% discount! Yaaaaaaaay! The food is good and they actually make it spicy for you... just like Thailand.
author: Joseph M.

description: So good, the food takes a bit of time (because they are so busy) but it is worth the wait! The yellow curry and pad tai were fantastic, some of the best I have ever had. I highly recommended this place if you are in the city and not in a huge hurry!
author: Ryan C.

description: Tried a new dish and the Guay Tiaw Lord is amazing! Glad to know last time was just an off day. Great food and service!
author: Bradley V.

description: If you are visiting the downtown area and need a break from your shopping, then I really recommend coming to this place. There are many other thai restaurants nearby but this is far my best place to go. My bf had the bbq short ribs and I had the pad thai beef. I tasted the short ribs and they were okay but I really loved the pad thai beef. I also order the chicken satay which was a good portion ( 5 skewers ).
author: Maria T.

description: Ordered for delivery. Beef in the pan fried noodle dish was ground beef and unappetizing. We got a 3/10 for the spice level and it was so incredibly spicy our lips were burning for a while. Also tried the garlic chicken with white rice. Dry chicken and it was pretty bland. Overall, very mediocre Thai food. Would have give a 2.5 but that's not an option.
author: Tal A.

description: This was by far some of the best Thai food I've ever had. And I live in NYC. We've got some good Thai. But this food was so fresh, spicy, and delicious. I got the pumpkin curry and had to wait a while for my take out order , but it was well worth it. Plus, it's a family business with mom cooking everything up fresh, so you know you're getting something good. The next time I come to SF, I will be heading straight to this place. Yum!
author: A H.

description:
Tried this place a couple times. Don't waste your money. Food is okay but the customer service is atrocious. Almost every dish was not as ordered and they tacked on gratuity for a 3 person bill (I suspect they knew we'd tip poorly for the sub par service). My friends decided we shouldn't say anything about it, but honestly I felt robbed after I left.

Instead, checkout katana ya. It's sort of close and they have great dishes.
author: Eric B.

description: So far this is one of my favorite places to go for curry. I had the yellow curry, my friend the pumpkin curry, and another the roasted duck soup... All the dishes were great! The curry flavors are well developed, the duck broth was amazing! Also the staff is super nice and super friendly. I totally recommend  this place!! Oh and their Thai tea is awesome, hot or cold!
author: Cassie D.

description: i am hanging out with my friends here.  we really enjoying the meal here.  Angel wing is really nice!!!!!
author: Secret L.

description:
Today I needed a quick bite, was in the mood for Thai food and remembered my fave Thai restaurant on the corner of Taylor @ O'Farrell only it's gone now, the new place is called Million Thai. I gave it a try and glad I did. My favorite dish is the Kao Gra Prow with sautéed ground chicken, bell pepper, thai chili and basil served over steamed rice; it's all about the basil and chili! I started off with the cucumber salad, perfect sweetness and tart flavor with red onion. They have a special right now, free Thai Iced tea with your entrée' order. 

The staff was pleasant, the food was easy on the eye to look at and tasted wonderful, I'd definitely go back.
author: David P.

description: During our recent dinner visit the dining room temperature dropped like 30 degrees as new guests arrived or exited making for a less than pleasant experience.  We ordered soup first with the request to bring our entrees after.  The  entree's arrived before we finished the soup against our request.   We requested chop sticks which required a second request.   Though it wasn't described otherwise on the menu, the almond chicken was served fried (and rather greasy)  rather than sauteed as we have had it elsewhere.  The pumpkin curry was very good.
author: David R.

description: Amazing Thai food!!! We ordered delivery, we had Tom Yum Gia, Yellow Curry Chicken, and Veg egg rolls! Delivery took exactly an hour. When it arrived I opened the door to find a young man with a bicycle and helmet holding my bag full of food and the biggest smile, he immediately apologized for breaking the container for my soup, but reassured me the continents were contained within a bag and instructed me to just pour it into a bowl. After sorting out the bag we took our first bites....I fell in love! I told my husband I didn't care if my soup would have come in a shoe, it was amazing! How that kid managed to deliver hot  delicious food and crispy egg rolls on a bike in the cold is talent!
author: Krystal T.

description: Got a groupon $12 for $20 worth of food. Service was fast and friendly. Food was delicious and they had beautiful orchids on every dish!
author: Sierra R.

description: Tried the yellow curry and it tasted delicious, though it was more watery and less coconut milk than I'm used to. But again, still tasty. Also the staff was very nice.
author: Sophia R.

description:
We happened to be staying right down the street from this restaurant, so by the end of our trip, we had dinner here. What stood out most was their presentation. When you order a Thai iced coffee, they present it to you with a rose made out of the straw's wrapper. When you order pineapple fried rice, half a pineapple is hollowed out to act as your bowl! It is a very enjoyable experience!

Food highlight: pineapple fried rice
author: Ashly S.

description: So good yummy my favorite food tonight Roasted pork nuked A+++ .1-10 I will rate them 10++
author: May B.

description:
It was delicious! I like the duck curry! 
The Padthai was good too! Try the Thai roti! 
Everything was good! Like it! Like!
author: Jing W.

description: I order a Thai style rice(chicken). The rice taste pretty good but the chicken is a bit old(?). I will definitely come back and try something else. It's a good place to eat and pretty connivence if you shop around downtown.
author: Chris Y.

description: My favorite Thai food downtown. The staff is great. The food taste just like it does in Thailand. Make sure you order the laab ped
author: Daniel N.

description: Came for the pumpkin curry because we heard it was good, and it WAS! Loved everything we had!!!! The pineapple fried rice was a group favorite, as was the scallop and avocado curry! Thai tea delicious Yum! Would definitely recommend this place, service was great :)
author: Madi M.

description: Had the pad Kee Mao. It was amazing. Nice large portion. Had the mango sticky rice, always one of my favorites. Right next to the Serrano hotel. I would recommend this to anyone wanting good thai food in the area
author: Jennifer N.

description:
The food LOOKED good but...

Small portions, everything was overpriced

The pad thai was bland--the waiter recommended we get it with prawns. There were no more than 3 prawns.

Seafood fried rice was also bland.

BBQ beef was DRY and overcooked.

service was meh... waiters/waitresses were not attentive, they were too busy chitchatting with each other and playing with their phones.

Definitely will not be back.
author: Carrie L.

description: Ugh. Not so great. I ordered delivery via Eat24. Through the online order, I specified EXTRA TOFU in the soup. The food took well over an hour to arrive. The main reason for two stars: there was no tofu at all in the soup, despite specifying extra tofu (and being willing to pay a bit extra for it). The vegetarian fresh rolls were good.
author: Karen R.

description:
Found out that they charged me full price even after I showed them Groupon. 
Worst experience.
author: Steven L.

description: Excellent Pork Knuckle and real Thai style Papaya salad. I am happy to have stopped in on a cool fall evening for a tasty Thai meal. They have plenty of beers on tap to choose from, along with spicy papaya salad.
author: Anthony C.

description:
Million Thai used to be around the corner from my loft, and I ordered from them all the time.  I loved their food, even though in truth it was totally overpriced.  So I was kinda bummed out when they moved locations.

Tonight I wanted to order Thai, and decided to use GrubHub to order dinner from them.  We ordered $80 worth of Thai food at 7:30pm.  It is now 9:28pm.  They have updated their delivery time 3 different times, and then claimed that they tried to deliver to this address 30 minutes ago (which still would have been over an hour later than their original estimated delivery)  but that when they called my number, someone in NY answered.  Clearly the delivery driver doesn't know how to use a mobile phone.

I just got off the phone with both GrubHub, and Million Thai, and they said "15 more minutes".   I told GrubHub to GFY & that I'll be charging back the order, and they said I will never be able to order through them again if I do that.  So *if* the delivery driver arrives with my order of thai food that sounds like it's been sitting in a car for over 2 hours, I'll still get to pay $80+ for what has essentially become well traveled leftovers.

No wonder the name Million Thai.  This business clearly wants to make a million based on poor customer service.  

And ruin my Saturday night.

Thanks *ever* so much Million Thai.
author: January S.

description:
To be honest, my girlfriend and I was looking for Osha Thai for thai food. It was a date, so I wanted to take her to a fancy place. Unfortunately, Osha was closed (Christmas), and I decided to give this place a shot. 

As we stolled down the block towards this restaurant, we became more and more distraught as the buildings became shittier and the streets dirtier. My stomach clenched. I thought I was about to take my girlfriend to another shitty place. How many bad dates can she handle? I cried a little inside.

When I opened the door, the place sparkled with fancy wine glass and the waitresses greeted us with smiles. The place was sparkly and inviting, I felt like I entered a new world. We sat down, looked at the menu, and ordered.

My girlfriend ordered beef stew. I munched on her beef and slurped her soup and it was really good! What really blew me away was their Roti Prata with curry (appetizer). It was really really good Roti Prata, unlike any I've ever had. Most stores sell thin and crunchy Roti Prata, but this store's roti prata was thick, chewy, and I enjoyed my little slice of heaven.

I ordered green curry with rice. How spicy (1-10)? 8. It was very spicy. These people are not afraid to put spice in your dish, so if you enjoy spicy food you will love this place. With sweat dripping down my face and mouth drooling with chilli, I looked my girlfriend and she was happy.

It was a good date, we walked out of this restaurant bloated with happiness.

P.S. At the time, there was a coupon on YELP that you can buy for a discount. After the meal, we bought the coupon, showed it to the waitresses, and they knocked a hefty chunk from our receipts. It was probably one of the tastiest, cheapest date I've been on that month.
author: Song Z.

description: Got my delivery order wrong. Incorrect noodles, none of the dishes were spicy (we only wanted one of the dishes to be mild), and they forgot the chopsticks we specifically asked for. Even if they got it all right, the quality and portions do not justify the price.
author: Jason H.

description: My husband and I were traveling in San Francisco and decided to try this little Thai spot. The staff was friendly, attentive and the food was excellent! The perfect amount of spice, beautiful presentation and very reasonably priced. The restaurant is clean and quaint. As in all of San Francisco, parking is tough, but the restaurant is just steps away from the muni lines 19 and 38. Made for an easy ride to and from our place of stay. I would definitely recommend!
author: Trina L.

description: Lovely food. Quick service. Everyone is really warm. A must go Thai place if you're in this area
author: Tanya S.

description: The food at Million Thai is absolutely fantastic. Some of the best Thai food in SF. Don't let the location or the small, informal dining setting concern you. Everything on the menu is fabulous. My favorite is the lemon chicken (it's grilled to perfection).
author: Kathleen T.

description: Very good Thai food! Run by a Thai family husband and wife. Small dinning area and only one waitress on the flood. But is still very busy even at 2 o'clock in the afternoon. Will come back next time and try something else!!
author: Kristine L.

description:
This place was right next to the hotel we were staying at in SF, and we walked by, the greeter offered us a 15% grand opening discount--well, who am I to refuse a deal?
They offer free delivery too.  And we ordered that the next night, if that tells you anything about how much we liked this place.
At the restaurant, the service really shines--a washcloth brought for each person before your meal is a very nice touch.  As are the fresh flowers in each dish.
The food is solid.  I can't say I'm a Thai food expert, I just know what I like, and I like Million Thai's food plenty.
author: Ken V.

description: This is my 2nd time eating at this place and again.. we all enjoyed our food, We were lucky to be visiting SF again and since our first visit to this restaurant was very nice, we made sure to come back again. We did not make any reservation and we were a group of 5 and they managed to sit us immediately. The only issue, the restaurant is very small and they get a lot of take out orders being picked up. And the fact that SF is very windy, every time the front door is being opened, you get cold air coming in and your food gets cold very easily. Other than that, I really like the food at a decent price!!
author: Mauritz N.

description: Awesome authentic thai food! Its hard to find good spicy thai food but this place was delicious. Thai iced tea and pad kee mow was delicious!
author: Tori J.

description: Be awesome Thai restaurant. Today, I tried duck noodles soup that it was great. Let's get it
author: Aooair A.

description:
Pad Thai was flavorful and delicious, I went for lunch and sat at the bar chatting with the staff, so that may have helped.

Very friendly staff. 

There seems to be a prolifriation of Thai food places in the area with good reviews, but I think you should try this one as well, clean, friendly and delicious.
author: Scott P.

description:
i am thai and to be honest, million thai has the best option for thai food. they provide alot of variety and the flavor is closest to the food in thailand. i like to order thai salty crab papaya salad (som tum poo plara) and bbq pork (khor moo yang). i come here very often for dinner with my friends. i always have the soft bone pork soup (tom zaab kradook moo) which has a different flavor than other restaurant. 

as a regular customer, i will be back again.
author: Chuthamas W.

description: Best Thai Place in San Francisco! OMG their noodles are amazing and I love the Thai tea as well. The service was exceptional and they really attended to our needs. I definitely recommend this place and will surely be coming back next time I visit San Francisco.
author: Oscar R.

description: I like this place since it is very close to my work. The three times I have been here I have stuck with the Pad Thai. Their service is good. I have heard mixed reviews about the Duck Noodle soup. The last time I came here and tried it, it was wayyy too sweet. Guess I'm just gonna stick to my Pad Thai.
author: Vanessa Y.

description: This place was awesome the pad Thai was amazing and the fried rice was good but it was too much.the Thai tea was like the best I have ever had . The shrimp rolls were really fresh
author: Mustafa R.

description:
This location is very different from when they were located on 5th St. near the Westfield Center.  If you like authentic Thai food, go to their Van Ness location.  If you like bland Thai food, than this may be the spot for you.

Seriously, I ordered Som Tum Poo Pla La (Papaya salad with raw crab and fermented fish sauce) and I could barely tell there was any sort of fish sauce in the dish.  In fact, I think it was regular fish sauce diluted... not even the fermented kind.  I also asked for Thai spicy and it came out falang mild!
author: Dennis Z.

description: If you are in the area for conference or work this is a good spot for Tasty freshly cooked Thai..its not a fancy place but doesn't need to be food is excellent. Prices really good. Spice levels on 1-10 for any dish so you can have it as mild or spicy as you like.. I did a 6 and was as spicy as I would go whilst still retaining taste.. Fresh rolls, softshell crab and the curries are great..  I'm sure there are fancy places in SF.. But my feet were killing me after DF14 and it was opposite my hotel . Staff really polite. Food excellent. Good value for money.
author: Trevor A.

description: So I couldn't help myself. Brought some friends for round two here!! Everyone loves it. Servers are nothing but kind and attentive. The only warning I would say is be careful rating how spicy you like things. Five really means a 10. ;p I would recommend a 2-3 when they ask and it will taste perfect.
author: Alana P.

description: Waitress "Ning" was not friendly and could not get our order right. Food was ok but very slow coming to table even though it wasn't busy. Then the orders were mixed up when it got there. No refills, bad service, and negative attitude resulted in a low tip. "Ning" saw the low tip as we were walking out and directed a negative attitude and comments to us. We won't be back.
author: John A.

description: Enjoying some awesome Thai food on Valentines day. The Thai soup was just delicious with such great flavor..
author: Jose P.

description:
Not a bad place considering we stumbled on it walking around union square. 

We ordered Tom Kha soup, Red Curry and vegetarian Thai fried rice. All of them tasted pretty good and flavorful. In addition we ordered a bottle of 2010 J Lohr "Seven Oaks" Paso Robles Cabernet Sauvignon which paired with the food pretty well. 

Tom kha, though tasted good, didn't taste like tom kha may be it's a different spin on it. Definitely a place I would go another time when I am in the neighborhood

The service though not consistent was adequate.
author: Ravi C.

description: I saw one chef didn't take his gloves out while smoking outside and still using the old one when he got back to work. So.... disgusting.
author: Lovely B.

description: I love this place so much, this's my second time here I'd like to say everything's amazing here. Here's my favorite Thai restaurant in SF.
author: MD G.

description:
Terrible pad thai - bland, flavorless, and with fewer prawns than I've ever seen in a dish with prawns (3? really?). 

If simple pad thai can't be done well, what does that say about the rest of the food?
author: Gleb P.

description: Good food with free dessert :) i will recommend frds to come back again. I love somtam and plakung! They are awesome. Free dessert is the plus!
author: Mandy M.

description: I remember when It was hard to find bad Thai in San Francisco. Thank you techies. Oh and did I mention muuuuch cheaper
author: Joumana J.

description: The oyster was really fresh. The food was really good. Pad Thai was delicious. Desserts were also good
author: Busay W.

description: Love the fried rice here especially the crab fried rice and the chicken fried rice! The prawn fried rice is also extremely tasty. This is the last meal before we fly home and this is definitely one of the food places we gonna miss here.
author: David W.

description: I haven't physically been to this restaurant but I have ordered delivery multiple times so my review is based solely on their food  since I have no experience with their service but let me just tell you, their food is THE BOMB DOT COM. especially their chicken wings which they call angel wings (& i personally don't believe that's an overstatement because they are TO DIE FOR.) It's just as mouthwatering as the famous San Tung wings (about $12) in the sunset but for almost half the price ($7) which is always a good thing am i right????? Their pad thai & pad see ew is pretty good too but it's the angel wings that got me consistently ordering from Million Thai. IT IS A MUST TRY YOU GUYS.
author: Jowee Z.

description: This thai restaurant nice food and very delicious. Whi come san francisco must come here.
author: Noom B.

description: A calm cool refreshing experience in the Financial District.  After the server brought us drinks she brought each of our group of 7 warm moist hand towellets to wipe off the grime of the city.  All of the food was excellent and served warm in a timely manner. It was not all served at the exact same time, the food is prepared and a relatively small open visible kitchen, which I like.
author: Jewel C.

description: Really nice and flavorful! I had the Tom Kha soup with tofu, is was really rich in flavor, with a sour side and just a little sweet. The vegetables could have been a little fresher, but very good. The combination appetizer platter was old, the tofu had the best flavor and texture. The satay was marginal.
author: Marshall H.

description: I am giving 5 stars not for the food although it was good but the great service and responsiveness of the sweet waitstaff thank you little gals!
author: M S.

description: I love this Thai Restaurant cause the food taste really Good , especially Thai style. For example like Som Tum Tard Mmmmmm loving it
author: Jirachaya P.

description: Awesome and authentic. Came in on a whim and we were pleasantly surprised. Food was decently priced and we were seated immediately. The staff was quite friendly. Portions are for sharing. The restaurant filled quickly during lunch. Limited seating available.
author: Susanna S.

description: They present really great Thai food. Especially green curry , I feel like back to hometown Bangkok.
author: Andrew T.

description: The food was okay but I was pretty disappointed in the service. I admit, we are kind of picky eaters (my hubs is vegan and I'm vegetarian). We ordered noodles with tofu and I wanted the pumpkin curry with tofu. They messed up the order soooo bad. First, the noodles had no tofu (fail).  Second, our curry came with chicken (fail). I sent my dish back because I didn't want chicken. When they brought my food back, it wasn't even pumpkin. It was potato curry. Wtf!? Not worth it. Can't even get orders correct.
author: Stacey A.

description: In San Francisco last week again ate three times while there with friends, always great food and friends are just amazed how good this place is. Thanks again for great food!
author: Mark Z.

description:
this opened recently up the street from my work and I saw the 15% soft opening discount sign on their window. After the 10th time I walked by I finally grabbed a to-go menu that were placed outside the door and promptly made lunch plan with my coworker as we looked over the menu. We went today an ordered the duck fried rice (which we had set our hearts on the second we saw it on the menu), the pumpkin curry with chicken, and pad see ew with beef. We didn't even realize there was a lunch menu until after we had ordered. But we didn't mind since we were set on that duck fried rice. 

Maybe we had our hopes too high, but the duck fried rice didn't blow our minds. It's not bad, but it's not something we will order again. It just taste like good 'ol regular fried rice from my local chinese spot with slices of duck in it. The pad see ew was not bad either. I usually like my noodles cooked more so they're not sticking together. The pumpkin curry was the best. The flavor was excellent and the pumpkin was cooked just enough so it's not too mushy or too hard. 

Our eyes were definitely bigger than our stomach and we totally had left overs. I'll definitely come back and try out the lunch specials. But if those fail me, I'll always come back for the pumpkin curry.
author: Janny N.

description:
Terrible.. The van ness location is slightly better.

Beef stew soup was tasteless.

Zen Yai / Lers Ros is way better.
author: Koalie W.

description: One of my favorite places. Food are authentic. Service is always nice. Affordable and reasonable too. Love it
author: Warut B.

description: Very overpriced food for the small size of kao gao tiam. Very little meat Nd the beef was tough as hell!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Angelo P.

description: Million $ Thai has always been my favorite Thai restaurant in San Francisco. Always worth a stop.
author: Jeff R.

description: We had the pumpkin curry and the seafood noodle soup. The food was prompt and delicious. The service was great and very the servers were very kind. I would recommend this to anyone.
author: Robert M.

description: The pad Thai tastes like noodles with ketchup. The chicken satay tastes like plain tenders cooked on a George Forman grill. Nice enough people. Shame they apparently lost their tastebuds in an industrial accident.
author: Brad P.

description: First  time I had eaten at this restaurant, its very small but the people seems friendly, I ordered the Red curry seafood dish and Thai iced tea, the tea was good,but the seafood Red Curry was total garbage food, this is what the seafood had inside a small bowl, one shrimp, 2 small fish balls cut in half, one artificial crab leg 2 small pieces, one small slice of squid ! Worst seafood dish in the world !!! It came with tofu but there was no salt on the tofu just a red sour peppered sauce ! I will never eat there again for sure !! The bill was around $17.80 ! Maybe the other dishes might be better but I have lost interest in returning to this place !
author: KC L.

description: Friendly enough service.   The flavors in the sauces were a bit ordinary, nothing really stood out.  We ordered the Pad Thai w/Shrimp & Scallops special (not much in way of shrimp or scallops), Chicken Satay, Panang Chicken Curry, all standard dishes for places we want to test out.   Pricey relative to ambience & portion & location.  There are plenty of places I'd try out before returning.
author: K N.

description: Service was not the greatest, the waitress seemed new but loved food! Duck fried rice and roasted duck noodle was great :)
author: Tasha C.

description: I liked the pad see ew, thai fried rice is good too. Portion is small in the price. Restaurant is clean only the waiter comes too often to disturb us, taking our plate away even we are not finished...the restaurant is 80% empty on 1pm Thursday. What's the hurry??
author: Shin T.

description: I've eaten here a couple of times in the week I've been here and it's incredible!!! Authentic Thai cooked impeccably!! Everything is so delicious and complex. And if you're looking for standard staples, they have that too. I would eat here on a weekly basis if I lived here!!
author: Karin M.

description: Writing this review as i sit in the restraunt....portions are on the small side and a bit bland.....disappointed....then when i went to use my groupon they were not happy...wanted me to pay the ballance in cash....the only reason i came was to use a groupon to try a new thai place....always looking for my new favorite....this place aint it!!! If you dont want people to use a.coupon dont put them out there.  I will never be back!!!
author: fred h.

description: Yum!  Just got done eating this here at my office by City Hall!  Panang Curry, Thai Iced Coffee and fried banana ice cream.  The best part was that they actually deliver.  I love them! Most definitely one of my most favorite places in SF!!  =)
author: Crystal C.

description: Struggled to put my household's order together.  Finally placed it.  Went about our business.  Eventually this terrible company let me know that they did not feel like delivering any more today.  You know, like long before they close.  No.  I'm not going to eat anything provided by people that behave like that.  Food safety is far too complex to put your health at risk with people like these.
author: James R.

description: We had ordered a "Thom Yum" soup, crab fried rice and a thai style fried rice.. the soup had stale chicken  (inedible) and was too sour... despite repeated instructions to make the rice extra spicy.. (thai hot),  we received a white rice with crab meat and shrimp... needless to say the food was bland and tasteless.... we did not like the food at all. For all those who expect a flavorful THAI food, This may not be the right place.
author: Swanand J.

description: Delivery was quick, food was hot but key parts of the order were missing like rice and sodas.
author: Yia Y.

description: Just ordered simple chicken fried rice and pad Thai. Stunned by both flavor and simplicity. Wondeful dining experience
author: Lee B.

description:
I went in for a quick lunch, because it was near my hotel and on my rewards program. I expected decent. I got excellent.

The food was really, really good, and the price was amazing. Their lunch special was huge, I had Green Curry, Fresh Rolls, Hot & Sour Soup, Salad, and Thai Tea for less than $12. 

If I had to give any constructive criticism, it would be that the plates were interesting but not the most functional for serving the meal.
author: Jeremiah S.

description:
I would give them a negative 10 in stars!!!!!! The worst customer services in the world!!!! Along with the horrible services that I received from the useless app of EAT 24. I received my order 2 hours later, when they said it would be about an 1 and a half. Gave them a call, and asked them about my order. The lady on the phone was the rudest person I have every talked to. Snapped and me and said that they were busy, and that's why your order is taking so long, then  hung up. When my delivery finally arrived, the sauce that came along with the dish was spilled all over inside the bag. Then when I opened the order,it was the wrong order. I called and complained, and the same lady answered was rude as ever. I told them I just wanted a refund, have someone come pick up the food, because I no longer want it. Having someone come get their food was faster then getting my food delivered to me. Once they recieved the food back, the rude lady had the nerve to call me and tell me that it was the right order. Who cares if it is or not. YOU WERE RUDE ON THE PHONE WHEN I CALLED, MY DELIVERY WAS LATE BY 2HRS, FOOD WAS SPILLED FROM INSIDE THE BAG, AND MY ORDER WAS NOT WHAT WAS PRESENTED IN THE MENU. DO NOT EVERY ORDER FROM THIS PLACE OR EXCEPT EAT 24 TO HELP YOU OUT! I did get a refund for my order, but what a waste of time!

DO NOT GO HERE!!! All these stupid great reviews, are people who don't know Thai food at all. There are tons of places that have amazing wonderful service and food. Go to anywhere except for this place!!!! If you're looking for a Thai restaurant, just go down on Polk or Geary, there are tons!!!
author: Veresa R.

description: Owner was nice enough to open late on new years! Ordered pad thai and pad see ew. Both dishes were well spiced and delicious. The meal was the crown jewel of the night.
author: Justin Z.

description:
Don't order from this place.  Food was bad and service left a lot to be desired.

I ordered Pad Thai with Shrimp, Fried Bananas w/Ice Cream, and a Yellow Curry delivered to my place.  They delivered on time; however, the food had some issues.  The ice cream was totally melted (okay, I'll forgive them since the delivery guy was on his bike), but the bananas were also totally soggy.  What really topped it off though was the Pad Thai tasted like fish like it was bad.  I've had plenty of fish sauce, but this tasted a little off and not like any other Pad Thai I've eaten.

I called them up to work something out.  I let them know what happened and just wanted a refund on the Pad Thai (figured I'd let the ice cream slide).  They wouldn't do it.  She told me, "10% off your next order. That's all I can do."  Excuse me? 

I said, "No Thanks", got off the phone, and started writing this review.  They actually called back to offer 50% off next time.  Still no go.  All I asked for was a refund on the Pad Thai.  The only saving grace for them was they called back two times upping their previous offer but still no refund.  Had they not called, this would be a 1 star review.

I hope they figure out that this is no way to gain new customers or keep those they already have.
author: Justin H.

description: This place is a scam!! Waitresses were mean. Food was indecent. They put hidden fees in the bill. Be on the lookout that they sneak in gratuity fees on the bill. I consider that very bad business practice. Never going back and I warn that you shouldn't be going there too!!
author: Alik H.

description: Best panang curry of my life. I usually get medium spice so i got 5 out of 10 stars and it was perfect.
author: Jen S.

description:
Do NOT double tip:  We have a party of 3 but automatically being charged for "service fee" of 18% on the check!   Also, the restaurant may think that is not enough, they wanted me to fill out section called "gratuity" again!!  They think I am stupid/careless that do not proof read the check ?!

Also, although the food appearance looks "fancy"; but the food quality is not good at all.  Pad Thai is mostly has sour noodles; Duck fried rice is mostly just rice with duck skin without taste.  
I thought about giving 1.5 stars (instead of 2), but thinking about they seemed to trick me to double tip plus; charging us extra tips automatically even just party of 3, that made me feel upset.
author: Felix C.

description: Mediocre service and mediocre food. Ordered the pad Thai and I have to say it was the most flavorless pad Thai I have ever had.
author: D G.

description: Do not be put off by the location or the tired exterior.  The inside is cozy and clean.  Million was fantastic!  We chose this restaurant by chance, had not looked at any reviews, and didn't know what we were in for.  What a great "discovery".  I really enjoyed the Panang Curry.  Would be very happy to have another meal there on my next visit to SF.
author: Tom E.

description: everything I've had so far has been great. i've gotten the spicy eggplant with chicken, which was great, not too oily, and one of the chicken curries. i made the mistake of ordering something "spicy" and it was so hot. i love spicy but for this place ill be sticking to medium spicy haha. still delicious though.
author: Sarah M.

description: The food was tasty and very reasonably priced.  We had a party of nine and they quickly seated us.  The service was a little slow but the restaurant was packed.  The servers were friendly and helpful with many choices.
author: Rick B.

description: Staying in the Hilton nearby, and needed a quick meal after a long flight.  Unfortunately, I ended up throwing out the shrimp pad thai.  After the third bite containing a random "crunchy" bit (one looked like a sliver of plastic, others must have been bones? not sure), I was quickly grossed out.  Even if there were no unidentifiable objects, the flavor was just not there--very bland, not even any lime wedges included to liven it up.  A very disappointing meal that wasn't even that cheap--considering the restaurant is a small spot mainly focusing on take out with no ambiance, I might have expected better prices.
author: Christine H.

description: The larb was spicy and amazing, as were the our entrees.  The service was perfect. We appreciated the late night service. Will definitely be back!!
author: ishai m.

description: DON'T order delivery !! Super slow, and when I called them, they just say it is on the way and hang up my call !! It was already 20 mins passed the estimated delivery time !!
author: Jie G.

description: The duck soup was really good and the service was quick.
author: Dan C.

description: The first time I got there, they rejected me because they said there will be a tour coming soon, so we got home after looking for parking for 30mins. The next day we went there again, because my bf wanted some Thai food(we was around that area so we come back again). The service is ok, nothing special. The place doesn't look romantic as the picture posted on groupon website. (I saw this restaurant on groupon, it looked pretty and romantic, that's why I bought the deal). Foods are not bad, but not as I expected, and the combination fried rice had some squids get stale and smell. Then at the end, when we paid the bill, we gave 10% of tip instead of 15% as they recommended on the bill, the waitress came and asked us to change to 15%. And she insisted, we didn't want to argue nor ruin our night so we gave little more tips. I swear will never come back. That made my bf upset because that was his BD celebration. I picked the wrong restaurant to celebrate. I felt bad.
author: Surgery S.

description: The perfect quick lunch spot, specially if you're here for conference at the Hilton. It's a pretty small place but they seem to be able to get people in and out. Few years ago they have lunch special menu but now it's just regular menu. Good vegetarian selection.
author: F.H. H.

description: Pad Thai was yummy, soft shell crab was crunchy, and the amazing Thai Tea washed it all down!
author: Tee S.

description: My husband and I split the green curry with chicken and it was really good! It was one of our favorite meals in San Francisco. Very tasty. #nailedit!
author: Tamara G.

description: Super awesome spot for great Thai right across from the hilton. Recommend the penang curry!
author: Cole H.

description: Ok but not great Thai. The pumpkin sauce was good but don't get the sea blend as the meat with it - it has fake crab and even fake scallops (fish meal). The Angel wings appetizers were really bad. Every Thai restaurant I have had that they are a chicken stuffing fried mix on a bone, here they are plain old Buffalo wings cooked badly (like rubber) with a thai bbq sauce on them. I have better Thai all around me back home in Monrovia/Pasadena.
author: Brian U.

description: I make it a point to eat here every time I visit the Bay Area.  Among my favorite green curry anywhere on the planet.  A five-star  Thai dive find. A winner every time...
author: Jeff B.

description: Great food and service!  Noodle soups and papaya salad are excellent!  Friendly fast service.
author: Jeff C.

description: Fast & efficient service. Lots of good options to choose from. Overall spice was more than the average. I ordered medium and it was pretty spicy. Go lighter than you would normally order.
author: Christy C.

description: Had appetizer platter, green curry, and fried banana and ice cream.  It was great. Go.
author: stevan w.

description: The service was terrible, every entree brought out didn't have a serving fork or spoon.  It was impossible getting the wait staffs attention as they were either texting on their smart phones or talking playfully by the dining counter.  We had to send one dinner plate back for being dirty with food residue.  The table of 3 ladies adjacent to us had the same problem...they also sent back a dirty plate.  The food was decent but they need a manager to maintain basic sanitation and service standards.
author: Doug W.

description: This place continues to impress.  I ordered crab fried rice and chicken satay.  The crab fried rice is just wonderful, with good-sized chunks of crab.  The satay is high quality meat and comes with a fantastic peanut sauce and a little cucumber salad.
author: Shana B.

description: Absolutely delicious food! Very hospitable! When in Union Square, this Thai Restaurant is a must!
author: Nina S.

description: Great servic and, great food!!!  Totally recommend it if you like Thai healthy food...
author: Celia I.

description: Great place to go late, everywhere else round here was shut. This place was an awesome find, with friendly staff and a nice atmosphere. I ordered the seafood noodle soup, with a choice of various noodles :) I got the flat ones, my favourite! I will come back next time I'm in SF :)
author: Katie O.

description:
Bf works down the street and goes here all the time. Today I went with him and didn't have high hopes because he thinks pad see ew is perfect anywhere. I got the pumpkin curry with duck. OH MY GOD. So so so so delicious. It's yellow curry mixed with pumpkin, so its very mild and creamy. I got level four heat which was the perfect amount of spice. The duck tasted so good, it was ridiculous. Even the chunks of pumpkin were just melt in your mouth butter type amazingness. Bf got pad see ew and it was a level six, which made him sweat lol. It was good, just a little bit too much...flavor...in the sauce. I don't know, he said soy sauce but I don't know the ingredients. 

Pad see ew, pumpkin curry with duck and white rice for $25. I see why he loves it here.

There were like five workers in a small restaurant so that was a little overwhelming. I also asked for what I couldn't eat to go and with only two other customers and five workers, it took ten minutes to get my food packaged. No worries though, food was worth it.
author: Heather M.

description: Delicious Red Curry. I loved the presentation of the food. They added a little jasmine flower to the plate. Would deffo return. I asked for Level 6 spice on a scale of 1 to 10. I would recommend asking for a 3 or 4, even if you think you can handle your spice.
author: A B.

description: Good food and good service. However, I asked them to remove a vegetable dish out, which they forgot. That meant I had to wait some more. I have eaten much better Thai food.
author: Jesper H.

description:
This is among the best Thai restaurants in San Francisco with regard to authenticity. This is no "Americanized" Thai place. I lived in Thailand for number of years and my friend, a Thai national who works at another Thai restaurant had ordered some of the "authentic" items and those ere just like how we have them in Thailand. 

If you're one those that believes you can judge a Thai restaurant by its Pat Thai (which is as asinine as judging a Japanese place by its edamame), don't bother going here. If you're looking for authentic Thai food, this is the place. 

Location is on Taylor right next to the Hilton San Francisco and Glide Memorial Church. It's open past midnight.
author: Flynt I.

description: Sweetest delivery service, and quick. Food was pretty alright for a quick online order. Soups/curry very flavorful and servings sizes were good.
author: Mahsa K.

description: Delicious! Had the pumpkin curry and seafood noodle soup. Both were great! Had thai iced coffee which was also good. You can see all the cooking action going on in the kitchen.
author: Charlie J.

description: I ordered combo papaya salad. Really love the laotian style papaya salad here.
author: Sunisa L.

description: This is my favorite thai restaurant in sf! Great atmosphere clean quick and excellent service. They have wonderful options for vegetarians.  A must if you are in downtown. We always go after enjoying the theater.
author: Sandra H.

description: Close to downtown, delicious noodle. Try beef noodle soup - very delicious hang over dish :)
author: Michael C.

description: The food was great! Especially papaya salad platter. The servers were nice and attentive. They also gave desserts on the house!! I will definitely come back.
author: Emily R.

description: OK...so they moved to Van Ness....Everyone starts off slow, but the servic e was still just as good as it was on 5th ave.  Tried the food over here and loved it.  Keep up the good work.
author: Kenneth G.

description: Just ok Thai food. We are from Atlanta and were expecting far better. Did not seem inspired or much different than what we can get at home at low end Thai places .Tried pumpkin curry and it was just soso.
author: Jann J.

description: Just had the pineapple fried rice that supposedly comes with shrimp and chicken...I searched for the shrimp & found just one. The dish was a bit tasteless and chewed on something that might have been an egg shell. Price is a bit ridiculous for the dish. $14 for a tasteless and meatless dish, not cool.
author: Ann S.

description: The worst pad thai I've ever had :-（Rice noodles are very dry and tasteless. Too few shrimps! Only 3 shrimps in my order. The good thing about this place is that it takes online orders.
author: Michelle L.

description: We Had Pad See Ew and Yellow Curry with chicken. Both were delicious. Our server was Mewmew. She was super prompt and attentive. Great service!
author: Leslie B.

description: Presentation was amazing....food delicious and service impeccable ..... Definitely a taste of Thai.
author: Helen R.

description: The pork rice and chicken rice are really delicious. I would definitely come again .
author: Xiaoting C.

description: Hubby and I stayed at the Hotel Monaco and walked here to eat at 9ish. Small place but attentive staff. Food was good. I ordered the soft shell crab basil and it was yummy! Great place to eat if you just want to have a quick late dinner.
author: Van P.

description: Great place. Had a Curry and soft shell crabs. Both very delicious. Water was for free. The place is clean and has a nice atmosphere. The waitress was also very friendly. I immediately felt welcome.
author: Mathias W.

description: wow & holy shit. super good! first time in a long time i've had tasty thai food. ploy II, osha, etc. - all fine. but this place? damn good, and at a reasonable price. i walked out thinking "5 stars easy". we ordered pumpkin curry (best tasted to-date), panang, basil beef, and mango sticky rice. while all the food was kick-ass, and the service fine, there were little unexpected touches that ramped-up the experience - e.g., creative food presentation (creative with regard to what's expected when you approach the restaurant from its tenderloin location), quality dishes and stemware. totally great experience eating at Million Thai.
author: Patrick W.

description: I ordered papaya salad the best.   Pad thai and pad see ew better than the last time close by my home. Price is not bad in down town San francisco.   They are so friendly
author: tata c.

description: Rocked it! Tom yum--- 2. Chains!!!  Soft shell crab, must have. The green chili sauce it comes with is epic. Beef Penang won't let you down. Post script, if you like spice, 7 is not enough.
author: Inn G.
